head.supplied: ¶ [Royal Soc. Medal. For copy of Agt Genls despatch fwding.]...

div.p: No. 1543, vol. 1889 N, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only, dated 5 February 1889.
[Royal Soc. Medal. For copy of Agt Genls despatch fwding.]
The Royal Society of London had awarded M one of its two Royal Medals for 1888 'for his long services in Australian exploration, and for his Investigations of the flora of the Australian Continent'. The Agent General was invited to receive the Medal on M's behalf and 'transmit it at your convenience to Baron von Mueller'(M. Foster to G. Berry, 9 November 1888 (Royal Society of London Archives, NLB/2/806)), and did so at the Society's Anniversary Meeting held on 30 November.
M's letter was returned to him on 6 February 1889 minuted: 'See attached file'. A request from the Premier's Department that the Agent-General's despatch be returned was referred from the Chief Secretary's Office to M on 13 February, minuted 'Return file'. M did so on 16 February with his thanks, and the file was sent to the Premier's Department on 22 February.
